summary:
Headline:
Netflix delivered a solid Q2 with 12% revenue growth driven by subscriber gains and higher ARPU, alongside improved operating margins. The company raised full-year revenue guidance to low-teens growth and expects operating margin at the high end of its prior range.

Growth & revenue drivers:
- Revenue increased 12% year-over-year.
- Growth fueled by steady subscriber additions and increased average revenue per user (ARPU).
- Content spend rose modestly but remains disciplined, focusing on returns from new titles.

Margins / profitability:
- Operating margin expanded by 150 basis points.
- Improvement attributed to normalization of content amortization.

Guidance & outlook:
- Full-year revenue guidance raised to low-teens percentage growth.
- Operating margin expected to be at the high end of the previously communicated range.

Risks / watchpoints:
- No specific risks or headwinds mentioned in the remarks.
- Watch for content spend discipline and subscriber growth sustainability.
